Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2011 09:34PM Bill_From_Bham wrote: Thanks to both of you for your replies.  We go back for a follow-up to the surgeon who did the mastectomy on Dec. 6, and I will ask him then about the physical therapy.  That will be roughly three weeks since the surgery.  We are electing to not do reconstruction at this time and the surgeon was very much in accord with that because he said this surgery we had done would not be as complex a surgery (one-and-a-half hours, actually) or as hard on her if we waited and did the reconstruction later IF she decides she wants it. We are definitely counting our blessings this Thanksgiving as my wife's tumor when discovered in May (she had had a mammogram in January!) was over 8 cm.  The saving grace was that it had not invaded the chest wall and we got right to the chemo within three weeks of discovery.  The TCH chemo just melted that thing away, even if it was tough getting through it.  Two things we learned from this board that helped: 1) at the first sign of acid reflux we started on omeprazole, and  2) stool softeners were used from day 1.   Thank all of you posters on this board for all your insights.
